1.author: SEPEGA
1.review:
I bought this Samsung open-box (saved $50) for my sisters apartment. I'm an audiophile and videophile so the sound quality was nowhere near what I would be satisfied with, but my sister was fine with it. 
Setup was pretty simple, it's all dummy proof with the wiring. The wireless surround speaker setup was fully automatic, works well. Make sure you connect to Internet and download any firmware updates before you bother digging into the settings during setup. By default, all the speaker channels are set to 0db, so the surrounds volume levels are WAY too loud and the sub is WAY too low. An SPL meter will be necessary to balance all the channels with the built in speaker test (you can download an SPL meter app on your phone for free).
Two reasons it didn't get 5 stars:
1) It says it's HDMI output has an Audio Return Channel (ARC) but it doesn't work with my sister's 42" Vizio with ARC. Everything was plugged into the correct ports, cables were brand-new HDMI 2.2, ARC was enabled on both devices...it should've worked. So I had to back to the store and buy an optical cable to get sound for her FIOS tv. Annoyed...
2)Within a week, my sister is calling me telling me there is no dialogue when she plays BD/DVDs. After burning an hour of checking it over, I found that somehow the system was sending the subwoofer channel to the center channel and the Front L/R to the surrounds, and completely lost the front channels. This only happened when the internal disc player was in use...when using the optical input (for FIOStv) everything was fine. Turning it on and off did nothing, so I yanked the plug while it was on and left it unplugged for 2 minutes, which seemed to reset everything. Hopefully nothing else silly like that happens again. Annoyed again...
1.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

2.author: Calculator
2.review_title: Nice HT system, one complaint, but Recommend.
2.review: Bought this to replace our 10 yr. old 5 Disk DVD/VHS Recorder AM/FM Stereo Home Theater System after it started acting up and not opening the DVD trays (different brand). We have had this new Samsung for a little over a month. This new 2015 model works great, newest technology, 3D / Smart Blu-ray Home system with FM receiver. This up converts DVDs to give a great picture, almost don’t have to spend the extra money to rent a BD disk, if you have a 42” TV as we do. It was easy to set-up connection to our home Wi-Fi. Make sure you check for and update the Firmware on the system. We had one update on ours already. The small speakers produce a really great sound for a home system in this price range. The wireless rear speakers are not 100% wireless. You have to plug the rear surround speaker wires into a 110v powered wireless box. Accordingly, if you want those speakers mounted on a wall, as we do, you will see the wires, and be limited to the spacing and placement distance from the 110v powered box. The biggest Dislike I have about this system is that I think Samsung made a design mistake by using Proprietary speaker wire Plugs for connection of the speakers to the main and surround speakers rear unit. They should have used speaker wire spring terminal connectors as they used on all of the speakers – Why use half one type connection & half a different type connection? The spring terminal wire connections are very easy to use – you have to use them anyway on the speakers! This design totally eliminates the use of heavier gauge better wires (included wires are very thin), unless you cut & splice the included wires! This also restricts the distance you can place the speakers from the main unit (wire size / gauge too small) plus the proprietary plugs on one end. Our rear surround speakers were placed on two sides of an open arch / wall span, so the design eliminates the use of my hidden wires for the rear speakers! According, we can’t place the new ones there now. Overall I feel this is a good system, would recommend, not sorry I purchased, but just be aware of the above speaker wire complaints that I have.
2.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

3.author: RockNess
3.review_title: Upgrade to an already great product
3.review:
This is a newer version of another Samsung home theater system we have. The older system is still working fine as it always has. It is now being used in a different space. We purchased the newer unit because it has better "smart" features, i.e. we no longer have to que Netflix shows from a computer in order to watch them via the Samsung system. (For those of you who may not remember the earlier days of Netflix digital content and many smart devices, you used to have to log in to Netflix via a computer and add shows to your Netflix que in order to watch them on connected devices. It adds an additional step and, by today's standards, is quite cumbersome.)
This newer unit has modern smart functionality and works great!
We are using this set in the master bedroom where running speaker cable for the rear channel speakers would be nearly impossible. This home theater system, (as did our older system), utilizes wireless rear channel speakers. The rear channel speakers plug into a relatively small receiver, (comes with the system), that is easily concealed.
Everything you need for a great sounding system is in the box and is very easy to set up.
In case you were wondering about the space where it is installed...
The master bedroom is quite large...
Probably 250 square feet.
The overall home is 6900 square feet.
This Samsung home theater system produces plenty of sound for the space.
I'm sure we will never use it at full power.
3.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

4.author: samsungLUVer
4.review_title: Almost a nice Home Theater System
4.review:
As you can see by my Nick name, I like most things Samsung, and when my old Home theater system died after 8 years (Samsung too), I decided to replace it with another Samsung. I am not fully satisfied with this "new" unit.

First of all, what was the Samsung software engineering team thinking? You can't adjust the user defined equalizer preset while actually listening to music??? This is very elemental and it should have been a no brainier. In reality, you have to switch away from BT, Aux, FM radio, etc. to go into settings and adjust the user equalizer preset and then go back to a music input to see if it sounds different??? My old Home Theater System had a dedicated button to adjust per channel db and much more. I am talking about the user defined eq preset (you can use the remote to cycle all of the eq presets, including the user defined eq but not adjust anything with music, it has to be done in total silence?). I want to be able to hear something while making eq adjustments to the user defined eq preset!

Another annoying thing is that if you want to listen to the FM radio while connected to HDMI to a Samsung TV (Anynet + ON), the TV switches input to TV and then the radio starts playing. So, I had to turn off Anynet and now the TV stays on the HTS input and the HTS goes to the FM listening screen.

Finally, why not keep comparability with old HTS remotes? The new remote is a joke, couple with the fact that the front plate doe not have a preset button. So, if you loose your remote, you will not be able to switch stations. My older Samsung HTS Unit that had a button in the front plat to switch between all of the FM station saved presets. This things should not be designed as disposable units. If Samsung design and quality does not go back to how it used to be, for Home Theater Systems, this recently purchase unit will be my last Samsung HTS (3 months old at the time of this writing),
4.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

5.author: ItsG
5.review_title: Decent system, but there are better ones
5.review:
I got a great price for this system around black Friday, plus I had gift cards and certificates. So I purchased this as an early Christmas gift for myself.
The main reasons I got this system was because it was Samsung a trusted brand, the price point and it was 5.1 and 1000 watts. 
Now that I have had it several months, I can give my honest opinion. 

The sound quality is pretty good. The first night I purchased it I watched the first Marvel Avengers and the surround sound was good considering it is a smaller theater system. I did like the bass, but there was a little bit of crackling with one of the speakers during certain scenes. The bass was not bad. Set up was easy. Bluetooth is nice. I have connected my 6 TB HDD to the system and I can play content from it with not real problems. Some of the AVIs aren't supported though. 
Plays blu-rays well. Processor it pretty good. 
The black color is nice, but does attract a lot of dust. 
The EQ settings suck. Music doesn't sound good in the music mode. You have to turn the system up very high some times to hear some conversations, the voices aren't clear enough.
Music sounds very washed out.
Doesn't come with an optical cable, I had to purchase one separately. 

I would not recommend. Save your money and you can get a much better system for around or a little more then what this retails for.
5.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

6.author: Andy
6.review_title: Worst Purchase I have ever made, Total Junk!!!!
6.review: I purchase my Samsung home theater system Samsung HT-J5500W 5.1-Channel Smart Blu-ray Home Theater System as an open box with Best Buy. I was happy at first but then the sound went out if right front speaker after only 3 times using system. I called Samsung and went through a bunch of testing and didn't fix unit. I was sent a UPS label and boxed the whole system up ( what a pain ) and sent it to Samsung waited to week and finally got it back, Hook everything back up and still no sound out of right front. Called Samsung again and then boxed up again and sent it back again and waited another 2 weeks got it back and hooked it up and still no sound out of right front . I have changed speaker wires and have swapped speakers around and still not sound. At this point I was pretty upset with them . I called and requested refund and waited again a couple of weeks with no reply. Called again and was finally called back one evening and was told it was approved for full refund BUT it had to go for final approval at another dept. LOL. :( NOT. I am still waiting for them to refund my money. This has been going on since Dec of 2016 and it is now almost the end of Feb. 2017. Buyer Beware Do Not Buy This One You Will Br Sorry!!!! I will not buy another Samsung anything because there customer service is very poor !
6.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

7.author: DMTCM
7.review_title: I was hoping for a lot better experience.
7.review:
After owning a Samsung - 5 disc carousel / surround sound system, I had hoped from the reviews that this might be a nice replacement to it. 
The sound quality was ok but not what I expected. The setup was very straight forward and simple. The rear wireless system was nice even though there are wires from the receiver unit to the speakers but that was ok because they were going to be hidden anyways. The main unit self linked to the receiver and there was nothing hard about the setup screen. The mids and highs were really crisp and clear however the bass speaker left a lot to be desired. I had the gain turned up to the max and even with a lot of bass signal from the video, the bass was very weak and unresponsive. The old carousel system would rattle the windows if I wanted it to. I was also reading that though this system would support 3D videos, i did not support 4K. As I only have a 1080P/ 3D system, for he moment it was not an issue but one to pay attention to. The real problem started when tried to stream a movie with VUDU. My wifi is through a major cable provider and I have a 60mb download speed. While trying to watch the movie, the video would pause every 5 seconds then play again. It was extremely annoying. I tried to use the Youtube app but ended up with the same results. I did make sure as the reviews suggested to update the unit before I started setting it up. The final straw was while switching between the menu options, the unit would not allow you to make another selection in the menu for several seconds after you finished with one. Even switching between input modes took awhile. Someone else noted this in the reviews and I had hoped it was just an isolated issue. I took the unit back and explained what was happening and BestBuy took it back with absolutely no issues.
7.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

8.author: Daniel
8.review: Purchased this a month ago, and the sound quality is very good. The "wireless" rear speakers are NOT wireless, The piece they connect too is. Still better than running wires across the room i suppose. Its behind my couch, and i have a speaker on each side. The interface is good. I listen to pandora alot, Youtube is kind of hard to use though. Tuner function seems to be alright depending on weather. Playing music, NO SOUND COMES FROM THE REAR SPEAKERS. I was disappointed when i found this out. Only the sub, center speaker, and front left and right speakers play music. I will say though while watching the movie Fury, the bullet ricochet had me ducking a few times. Overall pretty happy. The only two setbacks i have is 1) No sound from rear speakers during music and 2) Nowhere in the manual, or on the website does it state you need a audio cable if your TV isnt a samsung (I have a Vizio) HDMI cables WILL NOT WORK. Overall a good system.
8.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

9.author: AriG
9.review:
Was really looking forward to this and my boyfriend (who is all about sound) was actually excited too. We found this at a great proce because it was on the open-box area and decided to take a chance.

Pros: the sound quality is pretty good. The first night we purchased this, we watched Jurassic World and the surround sound was awesome considering this is a smaller theater system. We especially liked the bass. Also, set up was easy.

Cons: Although the sound was great, we can tell that this would only last about a year, max. The L/R speakers sounded like they were cracking a bit already. Another thing is that at random times, the Wi-Fi surround sound speakers would fail to connect and stop working. This happened every time as we watched movies and I have to tell you that it was frustrating. Lastly, another problem we had with the Wi-Fi speakers was that for some strange reason, they would not work whenever we played music.

Again, this was an open box item so maybe that had a lot to do with it. Hopefully this helps and you find what you're looking for.
9.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

10.author: Jeremy
10.review:
I have tried many products here recently.
Vizio 5.1 S5451W-C2, Nakamichi NK12, RCA and other Samsung brand sound bars.
This HTIB i will not complain too much and will say i would like to try out the Sony bdvn7200w but an satisfied with this model of samsung 5.1 surround sound.
I had originally the 7.1 HT-E6730W and loved it
Flaws and all.
The saying goes if it's not broke don't fix it.....yep i should have listened. Ha ha. sold it at a good price thinking i would upgrade.
I paid a good price for this and it was brand new
I will say the it's not as premium looking as i would like, however its performance thus far is great.
Cons:
1.I would like to see a more quality build and subwoofer in the future samsung.
2. Stronger bluetooth range
3. I would like to see louder and better quality surround speakers attached to surround transmitter. Although they are good.
4. Good remote, could be better
5. Could have more hdmi connections
PROS:
1. although not as as aesthetically premium looking as i like, it's performance has been astoundingly fast and precise. No issues other than bluetooth not allowing me to move all around the house.
2. model supports best ways to connect
(Hdmi arc) digital optical, audio video
3. Great speakers for a htib
They dont look like much, but wow and for a 1000 watt they get loud and stay clear.
4. Music sounds great and this has a few presets and options to tweak the bass and equilizer.
Movies and dvds look great and my games sound very nice.
5. Great entry level blue ray player and surround sound. i have no regrets at 197.00
10.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

11.author: JustinC
11.review:
This had everything I wanted!

First of all, to address other people's concerns about HDMI ARC with Vizio, yes it DOES work. HDMI ARC allows both directional connection using one cable. No optical or low grade RCA cables need. You must go the TV settings and turn on CEC. This will allow the Vizio to discover connected devices via HDMI. It will allow you to use the Vizio to control the Samsung and vice versa. Other TV brands may be similar. Then you can get surround sound from over the air TV! If you experience any audio/video sync issues, Vizio and the Samsung allow you to adjust for this.

Those who want a 2 channel music stream to play on rear speakers, your expectation is flawed. The rear speakers are only for the extra surround sound channels if such a source is used. FM radio, Bluetooth audio, music CDs are two channels. Not 6.

Blu ray player and Amazon Prime Video and other streaming services work great. Yes Amazon has many titles in HD and 5.1 sound. Love streaming movies and TV shows in surround! 

FM radio and Bluetooth work great for music.

Having no wires running across the living room is great. The wireless receiver is connected to the rear speakers by normal speaker wire.

My only complaint is about the buttons on the front of the device. I wish they were backlit. It is very hard to see what you're doing in low light.
11.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

12.author: Armydoodrules
12.review_title: Do not purchase. U will regret it
12.review:
Read some reviews. Some bad some good. 
I am a tech savvy person. No expert but I can easily connect speaker wires. Know how to use Bluetooth. And even re-image my home computers. Just so you know I'm not a regular dude. 

This system is horrible. 
The Bluetooth worked only twice. Hasn't worked since. I've tried numerous devices. Both Android and iOS. 
These very same devices connect to other Bluetooth with zero issues. 

I performed the system update on the Samsung. It's current. 

The speakers randomly work. 
I've quadruple checked the connections. 

I've ran the speaker set up. 
Funny thing. The speaker icons and the "noise" aren't synced anymore! 

So.... just to make sure the kiddos or dumb cat didn't mess anything up. I re-verified the proper color coded connections. Yep. Still correct. 

Now, 3 of the speakers aren't working. 

Even when the two rear ones were working, they were as loud as the cheap @&& headphones you get free with your phones.....

I'm 100% not satisfied but I am 100% going to return this. 
When I called Best Buy. They said they've had quite a few returns on this. Thankfully I bought the extra protection. 

So..... kudos to me for that! :)

Stay away folks. Samsung should stick to making phones. Wait, that's another topic not fire here. I mean, for here.
12.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

13.author: JGC72
13.review: While this item looks nice and has great sound & picture, it is awful. I purchased this item & straight out of the box I had problems. The DVD would freeze & the unit would become unresponsive. Without any actual buttons on the unit, the only way to get passed this was to unplug the unit, wait for it to reset & start over. Mid film. The DVD was brand new, so it wasn't a case of a scratched DVD. This happened repeatedly & sometimes needed to be unplugged & reset twice before it allowed me to eject the DVD or CD. I exchanged it for the same model, and still had the same issues. I instead went with a Yamaha A/V receiver paired with a Sony Blue Ray player & Yamaha surround speakers. Yes, I paid about $300 more (though Yamaha offers different price points for their receivers, depending on what features you are looking for), but the quality of the sound & picture is much better, as is the quality of the items themselves. Able to stream Spotify, Apple Airplay, Bluetooth with the Yamaha unit with much clearer sound & no distortion. An infinitely better product that's available at different price points. Do Not Buy This Samsung Home Theatre!!!!!
13.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

14.author: Loveagoodbuy
14.review:
Fantastic sound system, feels like I'm at a concert or movie theater, that is the experience this home theater delivers. Enhances the quality of whatever you are watching or listening to!! Should have bought it sooner. Easy to use and more features then I expected. You can get a complete big-screen experience from the breathtaking picture to the booming audio, out of the movie theater and into your living room.
This home theater system, surround speakers, and a subwoofer creates a complete surround sound experience that's easy to get lost in. And the 3D Blu-ray player pairs the audio with crisp visuals that leap right off the TV.
You can also use non blu Ray DVDs and with the built-in Wi-Fi, the options are endless! Watch YouTube, stream music with Internet radio, chat with friends on Facebook and Twitter, right from your TV, not to mention all the interactive Samsung apps. Do I sound excited about this home theater system, yes I am and so is my family! Complete entertainment package!!!
.Best purchase I made this year!
14.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

15.author: Steve
15.review:
I had a 6 year old Samsung HT E6730 go out on me. The Blu-Ray function stopped working. Rather than fork out a ton of money for a surround sound setup in the Kid’s Playroom I opted for something budget friendly. For $299 this is tough to complain about.

Setup is easy, just be sure to have an optical cable handy to run from the receiver to your DirecTV box. This is because the receiver only has an HDMI out. Run this to your TV HDMI in. Take your HDMI from your DirecTV to your HDMI ARC on the TV. Then optical cable from receiver to DirecTV box (as mentioned previously) and you’re set. 

Be sure to spend some time dialing in the speakers with distances and levels. I put my C and sub +2 dB, rear surrround +4, and front speakers at 0. This is in a room where the speaker distances are 10 feet max. Everyone’s will be different but I wanted more sound out of my rear speakers and C on purpose. I also turned the equalizer off and set the DSP to Power Bass via the remote. 

Lastly, be sure to upgrade the firmware immediately out of the box.
15.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

16.author: Kumar
16.review_title: Less Apps. Lacks Memory for disc. HDMI issue
16.review:
I initially liked it once I bought. Setting up the system was a breeze.
Issue 1: Most important issue. If you watch 30 minutes of a movie in your blu-ray/dvd, the next time you switch on, it starts again from 0 minutes. It should be from 31st minute. The system does not maintain memory. It is frustrating. Same holds good for movies played through external USB hard drives that you plug in.
Issue 2: It does not use Samsung Smart TV apps but only Opera Store apps which may is outdated. You may not get future upgrades. System may fail soon.

If you are fine with the above issues, then this system is good. It has quality sound for the price (Dont expect the sound to be anything near to a receiver and speaker setup).

In addition to the above issues, HDMI was not syncing properly with my LG TV (Model 47LM600). So I had to return. I bought a basic Yamaha receiver+speaker+amazon fire tv. And the quality of the sound is mind blowing. The total price was approxmately 400 (just $50 more), but it was worth it.
16.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

17.author: Regman
17.review_title: DVD Sound Is Off If Forward Playback is Sped Up
17.review: On page 28 of the manual for the HT-J5500W home entertainment system, it reads “The product does not play sound in Search, Slow, or Step mode.” I took this to mean that it is supposed to continue to play sound during fast motion FORWARD play (at last at the lower end of the faster forward speeds). For example, my PC media player will continue to play the DVD sound track at 1.2X, 1.4X or 2X normal forward speed (although the sound pitch and speed is, of course, higher and faster than normal, respectively; at 4X, 8X or 16X speeds, the PC cuts off the sound track). After reading this page in the Samsung manual, I was expecting that this unit would also play the sound track if the playback was sped up somewhat so that a movie could be viewed in a shorter time, however, the sound cuts out at ANY faster forward speed when the >> button on the remote is pressed. I then found the statement “The home theater does not play sound during fast playback, slow playback, and step motion playback.” on page 44 in the Appendix/Troubleshooting section of the manual. I think that the first part of the manual is ambiguous and misleading and that Samsung can certainly do a better job with its documentation.
17.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

18.author: Foolio4Sho
18.review_title: Good, but not quite what I was looking for
18.review: This system isn't bad, but I was looking to replace one that I had previously and it just didn't have all the same features. I liked that the rear speakers were wireless, so you can avoid the messy wires and cords and don't have to be creative running them where they can't be seen, but unfortunately, the surround sound is only when watching DVDs that are capable and not when watching regular TV or listening to music. Bummer. It was nice to have the apps like Netflix and Pandora accessible but, again, I was really needing that surround sound to surround me at all times. Set up is fairly straight forward and easy and I actually ended up connecting speakers I already owned because they were a higher quality. So, it's good for a normal home viewing experience, especially if you watch DVDs mainly, but it isn't going to get you any cinematic type experiences from all your different media sources if that is what you were hoping.
18.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

19.author: PS72
19.review_title: Firmware update 1012.5 disables center spkr & sub
19.review: Worked great for about 2 years until a firmware update disabled the center speaker and subwoofer. Since it was more than 1 yr after my purchase, it was not under warranty. I spent an hour with tech support who really do not have any good advice or solutions to fix an issue that was caused by their update from 1011 to 1012.5. All of my speakers worked fine with youtube, dvd, cd, thumbdrive, and phone via bluetooth. I noticed that 5.1 was disabled on Netflix, and tested my sound on all options previously mentioned prior to doing the firmware update via USB since it was not doing it via the online option. I had previously updated to the 1011.0 update with no issues. Unless you have purchased extended warranty on this equipment, you will be stuck with low grade stereo sound after the firmware update. If you enjoy taking equipment in for repairs and or wasting time performing useless fixes with tech support, then this is something you might want to purchase. Otherwise, spend your money on another company's product.
19.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

20.author: Jimmy
20.review_title: Good TV sound system for the $
20.review:
I was looking to update my system since software updates stopped and blue-ray technology has advanced to the point that I couldn't play some of the new ones. I am not an audiophile, I just want more than what the TV provides, plus I don't have a smart TV so I wanted some of those functions like Amazon.
This is a good system for the money (less than $400). Set up was pretty easy, except the speaker cables got left out, so I drove back to Best Buy thinking it would be easy to just have them give me a set. Believe it or not, the employee asked that I re-pack my equipment and bring it back then he'd give me a new complete box! Quickly thinking, I said, "well why don't you open that box you are going to give me and let's make sure there are cables in it." So he does -- he's carefully unpacking everything when a supervisor comes up, asks him what he's doing and when he finds out, instructs him to give me the &#@$ cables. Unbelievable! But I'm living happily ever after.
20.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

21.author: Gary
21.review_title: Best Buy Store 1044 in Las Vegas, NV
21.review: Issue is with this store in Las Vegas and not so much the product itself. Purchased a Samsung 1000 watt Blu Ray DVD home theater system for 249.99 last week. Set it up Saturday Nov 26 and central speaker did not work. On set up replaced with our old Sony speaker and central worked. Assumed defect so at 5 pm 11/26 returned to this store in open box and exchanged for one that works, When we packed exchange we inadvertently left DVD "Divergent"in player so returned to this store 2 hours after exchange at 7 pm. Spotted our return box still on customer service floor but now sealed and apparently inspected and ready for resale. CSR opened the sealed box for us but DVD was not there. Explanation was Geek squad probably tossed our DVD in trash. Might be true or not true as no way to know. All we know is that the DVD was definitely in the player when returned. It was easy for BB store to know a customer they can trace left a personal item but did nothing to really explain or accomodate. Request manager contact from this store. 702-750-2211
21.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

22.author: Seabass
22.review_title: Great system once figured out glitch!
22.review: I bought this system and a Samsung 48" T.V. at the same time. I was told I did not need to buy a Smart T.V. as the home system was Smart. Once home and all hooked up, I kept getting an error window saying "Not Available" whenever I tried to adjust the volume or do almost any function. Even trying to enter in info like email and passwords for Amazon took forever because after each letter was entered, had to wait for the error message to go away. After 3 weeks or repeated phone calls to Samsung plus a tech coming out for Samsung, Best Buy stepped in and helped us out. I took the remote for the home theater into Best Buy and when I pointed it at a Smart T.V., no error message! Pointing it at a regular/dumb T.V. on the Best Buy wall, resulted in the error message! Once I returned the regular T.V. and got a Smart T.V., there was no longer the communication problem between the two units and all is well. Kudos to Best Buy, boos to Samsung customer service for insisting nothing was wrong and had no idea why we would be getting the error message.
22.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

23.author: Jeepster
23.review: Installed the system and did a sound test and all speakers work fine. Then I went to the radio, TV and regular DVD and only had sound on the front two speakers. Checked and re-checked all wiring and settings. Did a hard re-start and it made no difference. Talked with Samsung tech support 3 times and still could not get them to work. Well it was finally told to me that it will ONLY play surround sound from a DVD that produces a 5.1 surround sound output. In other words I will never get surround sound from the TV, radio or standard DVD. This makes this unit absolutely worthless to me. I have a Panasonic unit that is probably 10 years old and it does exactly what it's supposed to do. Can't play blu-ray but at least I can play the radio in surround sound. Can't return it now so I'm stuck with a $350 entertainment system that only plays on two speakers. See if you can find that in the fine print. Samsung made a junk unit.
23.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

24.author: lwjack
24.review:
It is impossible to use device without remote control and the key sequence for anything other than turning device on and off or adjusting volume involves random key sequences that can number more than 7 strokes. The complexity will become clear when the first time user opens the 40+ page user's manual and discovers that more than 90% is devoted to remote control use. Universal remote use is another issue. I have a Samsung TV with a fairly simple remote which will perform some home theater system functions. In many cases a function can be started, but not finished, with the TV remote. 
Unless you use the system every day or have an extremely good memory, you are going to be using the user's manual on a regular basis, so be sure to make a few copies because the pages will wear out rapidly
24.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

25.author: okokok
25.review_title: Very good system for the price
25.review: Purchased this for my mom and stepdad. I installed it for them, so I can say from firsthand experience that it was very easy to install. Just follow the directions. Speakers and wires all color coded. Good quality product. Sound is great. Remote and navigation fairly straightforward. Streaming capabilities good, although app options somewhat limited. My Sony at home and our Roku have way more apps. They wanted Acorn, for example, and it wasn't available. All of the major ones are in there, though. This has the "wireless" rear speakers, which is great. The two rear speakers connect to a receiver that you can position in the back of the room. The remote rear receiver must be plugged in to AC power, and the two rear speakers must be plugged into the rear receiver. The wires for the rear speakers could be longer. May be fine, depending on how your room is configured. Had to buy longer wires separately for my parents.
25.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

26.author: Lito
26.review: Samsung - 5 Series 1000W 5.1-Ch. 3D / Smart Blu-ray Home Theater System - Black is excellent product for a home theater because it gives you the best quality sound, especially the mid-range when watching movies, at a very low cost. Thought, it does not have all the adjustments of the sound that you get from the mid-high levels home theater, the built-in settings are in good quality. Also, you don’t need to run wire for the two rear speakers. The only draw back is you have to run multiple number of HDMI from the TV, if it is mounted, to other devices like PS3, cable box, or XBOX. Despite this, I still recommend this for people who don’t want to spend money on home theater.
26.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

27.author: Halfacreshopping
27.review_title: Great addition to our family room.
27.review: We had been looking at replacing our old bluray/surround sound system for some time now. Saw this 1 on sale in the store, checked out some reviews and decided to go for. I love that the rear speakers have their own wireless receiver. With the old 1 we had wire strung all over the place. All of the wireless functions work great however occasionally after leaving streaming from the phone to the player it gets stuck in that mode. It's easily fixed by hitting the home button on the remote. I have not figured out how to get some apps to transfer over to the screen from my galaxy phone. YouTube and other video streaming site like vevo seem to work fine but I thought I could transfer anything on my phone screen to the player. If I figure that out this will definitely be moved to 5 stars. A coworker also like it so much he went out and got 1 for his man cave game room right after seeing mine. Solid product.
27.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

28.author: smart
28.review_title: Not 5.1 Surround Sound ,, but good sound.
28.review: I bought this system believing it was a true 5.1 surround sound ,, but my son pointed out it was not ,,, ONLY in Blue ray mood ,, so the rear speakers are useless unless playing a blue ray cd ,,, HOWEVER the overall sound of the THREE speakers that do work is great. I was surprised because they were so small and light ,, 1000 watts ? I don't know ,, have not had the courage to crank it all the way up ,, the base speaker is great ,, it makes me want to watch action movies to get that big boom ,,, I PAID $255 for the system ,, not bad for that price. OH and finally the real speaker amp ,, has to be plugged in AND it has wires ,,, UNFORTUNEATELY ,, Samsung did not give me enough wire to put the amp box on one side of the room ,,, and run the wire under the carpet for the other speaker ,,, it was stupid to make the wires so short ,, now I have to buy more wire ,,
28.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

29.author: tylerga
29.review_title: Significant improvement over built-in TV audio
29.review:
I had been going back and forth on whether or not to buy a home theater system. When I moved to my new apartment I noticed the vaulted ceilings created a huge echo rendering my Samsung tv with an overly flat and tinny sound. I purchased the sound system and it quickly filled my living room with lush sound and nice bass. I am not an audiophile, but I am very satisfied with the products sound.

Set up was relatively quick and painless. The box can be misleading in regards to the wireless speakers, the receiver is wireless, but the speakers are all wired, but the color coding makes it very easy.

The built Blu-Ray is nice but I haven't used it. The media center program built in is fairly clunky and wasn't going to switch us away from our Apple TV. The FM tuner is great, but I was delighted that the aux worked with my turntable.
29.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

30.author: LoveChristMusic
30.review_title: Better than my previous Samsung Home Theater!
30.review:
I had bought the Samsung HT F4500 a little over a year ago, and was pleased with it, but always yearned for a little more umph. When my center channel started going out, it gave me an excuse to look for a replacement system. Based on a majority of positive reviews, and of course the price, I bought the HT-J5500. Setup was a breeze. The rear speakers pair with the main unit automatically, so it really is plug and play. It fills my living room with more sound than my previous Samsung home theater did. I am also excited about the ability to stream music from my phone. The addition of Amazon Prime was also a plus for me.

My only reason for not giving it 5 stars is I know there are better systems out there, that push more sound, especially if you have one with a powered subwoofer. That being said, I think this home theater system is well worth the money. You will not regret it!
30.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

31.author: FVgirl
31.review_title: Great DVD player & TV home theater system
31.review: Needed to replace our previous DVD/home theater system after having it for 7 years. Liked the all-in-one package, and was intrigued with the added WiFi feature. Easy to install as it was very similar to what we had. Our TV is NOT WiFi ready, but with this new WiFi DVD system, it is- and it was easy to set up the connection! Sound is much better than the TV sound- probably not as high end as other TV home theater systems out there, but it is more than fine for us --- a great value for a DVD + Home theater sound system. Ordered it all on line while chatting with a Best Buy representative, and he arranged for a store pick-up. Transaction and Store pick-up could not have been easier!
31.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

32.author: EricM
32.review:
We purchased this home theater system after upgrading to a larger Samsung tv. Our good old don't sound bar did Not connect with the ARC connection(annoying). 
 THIS unit connect well with it's anynet connection. It did has issues turning off with TV a few times but only a few.
 One thing that does happen is that the sound timing becomes off, The picture doesnt match the sound. This could be my HDMI cable,my fios or the unit. I will have to isolate this issue one day.
The unit is a good low power theater system. It's base speaker is not powered, so don't expect the Big rumble sounds. Voice is clear and back wireless speakers add nice experience. (Wireless signal! You still have wires for the power. It's own power supply)
32.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

33.author: Chwo55
33.review: I been using the bluetooth for most of the day to listen to my music on my phone. It reads my phone pretty good from one side of the house to the other withe walls in between. Is there a setting to use all 5 speakers with music or is that just for surround sound watching movies? The sound is crisp and clear. I used the Blu-Ray for a bit and liked the picture. I did notice during the movie, I had to turn up the volume on some parts to hear the talking but then turn it down when some music came on. I still have to play around with the system but overall I am happy with it so far.
33.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

34.author: ChromeOrangeMR2Turbo
34.review_title: Good budget system, even better w/ speaker upgrade
34.review: This system has a lot of great features for this price range, most notably the built in wireless rear speakers. Really the only issue that I have as with all of these systems is the original speakers. It is silly to have a 1000 watt unit and then have speakers that come nowhere near needing that kind of power. Well that really wasn't a problem for me as I already had an amazing set of Paradigm speakers to use (check them out, they blow Bose and many other commonly known brands away) instead of the speakers that came with this system. The head unit has had no trouble at all powering my set up, and for a total of well under $1,000 I have a system that blows away a $2k plus Bose system, and I am not a Bose hater, I actually appreciate them for what they are.
34.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

35.author: NaniNash
35.review: 5 star all the way with this surround sound system, offers plenty features like Netflix, Amazon, Hulu and YouTube. Plenty more when you get this system connected to your LED or LCD flatscreen television. The sound is phenomenal 1000 watts sounds like your inside a movie theatre, but your inside the comfort of your own home. Surround sound is not only for movies but watching cable television as well once you learn all the functions this systems has to offer. This system is used for a bedroom but I am sure it can be used throughout any room in a apartment or home. Only had this system turned up to minimal sound the bass from the subwoofer is awesome. Years of enjoyment with this system, Samsung in my opinion makes some of the best electronics on this planet.
35.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

36.author: ericb
36.review:
Would not work with my LG HDTV (TV says "invalid format"). Samsung tech support gave me some nonsense about the aspect ratio and frame rate of my TV being incompatible with the HT-J5500W. The TV works fine with everything else I have plugged into it (old JVC system that I was replacing, Apple TV, Verizon DVR, laptop, etc., all using the same HDMI cable)

When I returned the Samsung system, the Best Buy customer service rep said Samsung deliberately makes some of their products incompatible with other vendors but that Samsung won't admit to it when you call them. I exchanged it for a Sony BDV-E3100 which works fine with the same TV.
36.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

37.author: skjo
37.review_title: Don't trust best buy open box items
37.review: Best buy rates open box items as excellent, good etc. I bought this item rated "excellent" condition, to me that means didn't require opening the box and inspect before leaving store - looks like thigns are different these days, quality of team doing return item checks and open item processing is going down. I recommend all open box items to be verified by customer before leaving store. This box contained a different series of blue ray player(with scratches and dent), got one part missing(wireless rear unit), center speaker was a different series too. I am returning this product immediately.
37.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

38.author: Midwest
38.review_title: Just barely acceptable but not for us
38.review:
We are tranquil audio equipment users: mostly listen to NPR on FM radio and want to do so the internet.

We hoped that this product would work for us because it offers an interesting set of features.

Unfortunately, they are assembled within in barely acceptable plastic--the shiny type that shows fingerprints and attracts dust.

More importantly (even in the relatively small space in which I intended to employ it), the product's sound quality is just OK .

Because just OK isn't good enough I returned the item.

But here is another reason I did so: I wanted the wireless rear speakers to produce sound when we listened to the FM radio. While I was advised by the Samsung that they would do so (via a particular setting), the sound was too quiet to hear.
38.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

39.author: Chel
39.review_title: Sound won't play through all the speakers
39.review: We hooked up our system only to find out the sound would not play through the right front and right rear speakers. When running the test, all the speakers pass but nothing is coming through the right ones while watching tv. I have tried contacting Samsung 5 different times with the last one promising a call back but I never received one. If someone doesn't give me an answer to correct this problem, I will be sending it back and if I get a different one it will most definitely not be a Samsung.
39.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

40.author: Here2Buy
40.review: Did my research and found this one. It got great reviews, so off to the story I went. Got it home set up took about an hour including going through the settings which was the timely part. Ran a check on all the speakers to find only the right rear, and sub woofer work, and nothing at all comes out of the rest. Yippee....spend $300 on something that you instantly have to troubleshoot. Changed all the sound levels on all speakers to high...nothing. Went around and unplugged then plugged everything back in....nothing. Call Samsung support....who ran the same test I did....nothing. Back in the box it goes, then back to the store I go. Needless to say I don't know which one to get now. Wish I could get back the time spent on all of this. What a waste.
40.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

41.author: SeriouslyMad
41.review: Seriously? Not a single digital input source? What's the point? I was sold this product with the understanding that this would be a great upgrade from my current Samsung Home Theater that is several years old. I was sadly mistaken that this is a serious downgrade. My 5 yr old system has 2 HDMI inputs along with composite. This has NO digital input, 2 channel analog input and pretty much only good for a glorified disc player. Since Samsung SMART services are extremely slow, i stopped using the streaming services via the Samsung servers so even that is pointless on this product. Terrible step back Samsung!
41.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

42.author: tonydh
42.review_title: I love Samsung, just not this one.
42.review: I have all sorts of Samsung products. This one left a bad taste for me at least. I have a 65" TV that i wanted to pair up with a surround sound. This surround sound really kinda sucked at least for me. It paired up great and did what it was supposed to do. Just not loud enough, surround doesn't work with Plex (for those of you who know what that is). Also, the wireless speakers plug into a separate receiver box. Why not plug into a wireless sub-woofer and skip the extra box and power consuming devices. I tried a Samsung soundbar after this, TV sound sucked, but music sounded great. After that I tried a Vizio soundbar with wireless sub-woofer and satellite speakers. LOVE IT. Go figure, a Vizio beat out Samsung.
42.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

43.author: EricGio
43.review: I used to have an old Sony HTIB (home theatre in box). But it broke and I needed a new one. I tried the Samsung with Wireless rear speakers and the sound quality was awful. I then purchased this Yamaha system open box, $100 off. It was missing the remote and YAPAO device, but I was able to find both of those on Amazon so I still saved. And this unit is awesome! The sound quality is really good in my opinion for a HTIB and the base is great too! I'm very satisfied with this purchase and glad I went Yamaha. I didn't want to spend more for a custom system and I feel this is the best otherwise.
43.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

44.author: Kbbs
44.review: This is my second Blu-Ray Home Theater system. Loved the first one; had the Geek Squad set it up. After many years it di d, so I ou chased this system. First, it was very easy to setup - the non-geek me did it! But, then I found that the remote was missing. Went back to the store but they could not give me one, so I had to buy a remote! After getting that remote programmed, I then found that the 'surround, remote' speakers didn't work. After checking all my connections and troubleshooting, I finally find out that they will only work on certain blu-ray dvd's only - not when viewing tv or movies from cable. Very disappointing.
44.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

45.author: danadan
45.review: I have several small bluetooth compatible speakers around the house so that was not a "must-have" when buying the system, but now that I have it I rarely use my other speakers. I love that I am able to wake up this system without the remote to play music from my iPhone (when I connect via bluetooth settings from my phone the sound system turns on). The installation was super easy and I have the rear speakers placed on a cabinet behind my couch (line of sight is not necessary for the rear speaker to connect with the main unit). And the sound quality (most importantly) is AWESOME. I'm glad I spend a little extra and didn't settle with a sound bar.
45.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

46.author: Saulty666
46.review:
I had been following this for a long time, as I owned a 500 wt samsung blu-ray for some years. Wanted more power with my new tv. First off, app selection is great, netflix, and amazon will get lots of use, they connect easily, and great. Blu-rays tested, play awesome, clean, sync good.
Cons: Overall volume, the same as my 500 wt, zero additional volume. Also, my bad for not reading specs, one hdmi. Old one had hdmi in, and out, had directtv, and blu-ray both running thru it, now, i believe i need rca cables to get tv volume controlled thru it.
Nice system, great price when i got it here, best buy even price matched when they lowered price next week.
46.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

47.author: JimmieP
47.review: This is a good system but I'm hearing the rear speakers are wireless. The system has a wireless module that allows for connecting to the rear speakers in a large room but you must connect the rear speakers to the module with wires. Correct? Also, one review stated the rear speakers ony work with DVDs but mine work just watching TV. Lastly, the sound from the rear/surround speakers are not as loud as the front speakers. Is this due to them being surround speakers? Any answers would be much appreciated.
47.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

48.author: hootowl1978
48.review:
My husband and I had a criteria that had to be satisfied before we bought a new surround sound system.

1. It has to have decent to good reviews - Check
2. It has to have 3D - Check
3. It has to have HD - Check
4. It has to sound good in the store - Check

When we brought it home it was easy to set up and sounded great right away. We had a small problem with the settings but I think that is because of the way we set it up. We have had it for months and it has worked great. I would recommend this to anyone.
48.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

49.author: Katysemi
49.review: I was replacing an older Panasonic system that had died. I was sold on the Samsung based on size/style of speakers and price. It was very easy to install, even for a non-Geek like me. However. The surround sound ONLY comes out of the front speakers! The directions say the back speakers (the real part of surround sound) will only work on 'certai. Blu-ray movies, never on TV'. What a disappointment! So, the semi-surround sound from the front speakers has good quality, but I have never yet heard from the back speakers. OH, and no remote was included!! Real bummer! Had to go purchase a universal remote. Another disaster.
49.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

50.author: Matt
50.review: Easy set up, speakers are smaller than older versions, and sounds great! I was a little nervous about reviews that said sound quality wasn't great and wireless satellite speakers didn't work consistently. I haven't had any problems with the satellite speakers and there's plenty of quality sound and volume for my 700 sq. ft. basement. I took a chance on an open box item shipped direct from the store, and was very pleased and surprised to find all of the components sealed in their original packaging. If the box wasn't re-taped closed, you would never know it was opened.
50.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

51.author: Jackie2473
51.review_title: Purchased for My Step-Dad The Sports Fan!
51.review: My mom and I got this for my step-dad as a father's day gift and an anniversary gift. He loves it because he's able to listen to his basketball, baseball, and ESPN channel on surround sound. Even though ESPN was on the TV at random hours of the day, now it's on ALL the time and my mom and I put up with it since it makes him happy. It works great as a Blu-Ray player as well and the sound of Disney's Frozen coming out with my niece and nephew really sounds great. The radio is ok, we don't use it often, but when we do use it, so far it hasn't given us any problems and sounds clear instead of searching for a signal.
51.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

52.author: ErrorOfCreation
52.review: For a system with small speakers this system has a large sound. The last time I bought something with comparable size speakers was fifteen or twenty years ago and you could count on them having a real tinny sound. not so with these, they have a full bass sound even if the subwoofer isn't operating. The only issue I had was the input jacks, my tv only uses a 3.5 jack while the receiver on this system uses RCA, Digital and Bluetooth so I had to buy another cable. At least all the inputs function separately so I could hook up multiple devices including my desktop. Also can't get HDMI sound input from tv to be reliable.
52.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

53.author: Fred
53.review: I bought the 1000 watt set because I had an older model of 500 watt that the rear speakers went out in and it got to the point it would no longer connect to the Samsung TV. Long story short I contacted Samsung support and told me it was junk at that point. While it worked i loved it so i decided to go with the upgraded model and i wasnt disappointed. The Samsung name to me holds great quality value. It packs a good base and my favorite feature it being able to universal control both the tv and theater system at the same time with one remote.
53.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

54.author: Jeremy
54.review: Well not play any disk without optical cable. Put in disk and they play for 10 seconds and you can't bypass in options settings unless you are quick (10 seconds quick ) i was disappoint because it took me 3 hours to get pass the bypass in settings because system kept resetting even in the settings without an optical cable hooked up to cable box (my cable box had no optical cable plug )The speaker wires got to be the smallest gauge i have ever seen and is not set up to use your own speaker wire. I am going to return and just buy a receiver and not worry about any optical cable , or supper cheap speaker wires
54.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

55.author: Biffjerquee
55.review_title: Completely unable to use with headphones!
55.review:
Since the box for the product and the online description stated bluetooth was built-in, I assumed that meant I could my bluetooth headphones. Once installed, I could not get my headphones to work with the product. I called Samsung customer service and they told me that, notwithstanding what the box and the online product description stated, the product was not designed to work with bluetooth headphones.
Here's the kicker, there is NO HEADPHONE JACK on the product, so I can't use a bluetooth dongle to make it work with my bluetooth headphones and I cannot even use my old fashioned corded headphones. RIDICULOUS!
55.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

56.author: Fedup
56.review_title: Terrible, returning it. Worst electronic piece I
56.review: I spent almost 3 hours on the phone 1st with Samsung because I can’t get the tv volume to play thru dvd/receiver. I had it hooked to a LG tv, of course Samsung says it was an LG issue. Call LG still couldn’t get it to work. I then hooked it up to my new 65 inch Samsung smart tv. Still no volume, Call Samsung again, still nothing, changed hdmi cables, attached optical cable, still nothing, now Samsung says its the cable box. Not. I’m taking it back, I’m fed up with Samsung. Very disappointed
56.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

57.author: Cris2for
57.review_title: Great Surround system for the money.
57.review: I had a old Surround System that I sold. I thought I'd jump on the bandwagon & get a sound bar with a subwoofer. I tried to like it but it just couldn't give me that Surround sound I had been use to. I took the sound bar back & got this Samsung Surround system as a open box at a nice discount. I hooked everthig up to my new Samsung 65" tv & turned everything on & to my great surprise it all synced together on its own. Even the remotes synced up. I'm very very happy with this system. The sound is awesome & better than I was expecting. I highly recommend this system. The bluray DVD is great also.
57.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

58.author: Becky
58.review: This is a wonderful product! Samsung never disappoints! I looked at a few other options, however, opted to pay a lil more and go with this system because it is wireless. It's wonderful to watch NetFlix without having a wired connection! The apps you can get for this (Netflix, Pandora, etc) and the ability to connect wireless to the internet are huge! The sound quality is amazing! Again - Samsung never disappoints! There are many sound systems out there - I say spend a lil more and get this one that's wireless, it's so worth it!
58.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

59.author: Starfire116
59.review_title: Good system, small and easy to use
59.review: This seems to be a very good system. It was easy to set up and the size fits easy in the space I have. The sound isn't the most exceptional but it sound well enough to be good. It doesn't have every decoder in it but it has the major Dolby Digital and True HD sound. It is great for my bedroom but it might be lacking in features and power for a full blown home theater system. I like the fact when it's paired to my Samsung TV it has Audio Return Channel and plays the sound from my TV which is a great plus to the speakers in the TV. All in all it isn't bad but there is also better.
59.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

60.author: sitarbob
60.review: Best Buy gave me this after my Samsung Blu-Ray 5.1 Surround Sound System with a tube pre-amp quit working at the tail end of it's extended warranty. I took my unit in for repair but after a snafu with Geek Squad, it did not reach the repair center before the warranty expired. the store manager kindly gave me this as a replacement. it lacks the tube pre-amp that my previous unit had, but it came with some other bells and whistle, like "built in" YouTube, a free 30 day Netflix trial and some other goodies. So far, so good!
60.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

61.author: Anonymous
61.review:
My 6 year old Panasonic theater set up went out on me so I was looking to replace it. We have a Samsung TV in anopen concept living room / kitchen. I didn't want a sound bar as the room is too big for that. 

I was extremely disappointed once this system was hooked up. (Hook up was very easy.) It sounded no better than the speakers in the TV. There was no bass from the sub at all. I checked, double checked and triple checked to make sure it was hooked up correctly and it was. The sound was not good. I returned the unit for a different brand and model and am much happier.
61.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

62.author: jdp404
62.review: If you are looking for an entry level theatre system with some nice features that is not too hard on your budget, this model Samsung system is it. It is a complete set-up with minimal challenges during connection and programming. It delivers an improved level of sound compared to your standard tv speakers and features a Blu-Ray player capable of playing 3D movies as well. This is not a system for a true audio/videophile but it is a great place to start for those who want to perk up your home video viewing experience without costing too much money.
62.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

63.author: PassingThru
63.review: Setup was ok except I had no audio thru the speakers. Thought it was ARC failing at first. Started moving thru items troubleshooting then found on Best Buys Web site a customer's answer to a question....wiggle the speaker cables and make sure the clamps are not down on the plastic sleep. Good grief, that was the problem. I pushed the cables too far in to the speakers. Been installing speakers for 30yrs, never had this problem. So, the reasom for 4 not 5 stars. Otherwise, deceit system.
63.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

64.author: JBTN
64.review: Bought this system to replace a similar Samsung unit that died after about 8 years of use. This unit sounds good and I like the smart features with the Apps. However, I have one major complaint. Unlike the unit I replaced, with this unit, you ONLY have full surround sound when playing DVDs and BlueRays. IF you're watching TV, the rear speakers do NOT produce any sound. Therefore, this unit does not sound anywhere near as good as my old one. My rating is really more of a 3 1/2 stars, but if Samsung fixes this flaw, it could easily be a 5.
64.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

65.author: BubbaNerd
65.review_title: Does what it says it will
65.review: We bought this home theatre system to replace a Sony that had software issues. This is a lower priced system that did not have all the features that the Sony did. It works like it is supposed to, but does not have the level of connectivity to our Samsung TV. The software in this system is also somewhat awkward. We have not decided whether we will return this system or keep it. I am saying recommend to a friend, but with the understanding it may not work as well as more expensive systems (understandably so).
65.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

66.author: Paul
66.review: The subwoofer was very weak. The rear wireless speakers are almost worthless and when they did work on DVD's, the sound was very weak. The center speaker quit working after two months. The system should be a 5.1, actually, it is a 2 speaker system. I had a 6 yr. old Philips home theater and it was great until a power surge wiped it out. Now, I will be looking for a Philips sound system. I expected more from Samsung, this is my first and last Samsung product! Very disappointed!!!
66.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

67.author: Sonny
67.review: This is my Second unit. I bought one for my home, and bought the second one for my apartment in a different city. I was really looking at not purchasing this in the beginning, but with all the good reviews I give it a shot. This device has proven itself to be worthy for the money. It's super loud, and with Bluetooth, radio, and screen monitor, you can't go wrong. It's sounds amazing!! I have a Bose system too, and this is almost just as good, but half the price. I just wish it had an hdmi input, to plug in my xfinity cable box. I would definitely recommend this product.
67.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

68.author: Sirkan
68.review_title: Beware of FAN NG (Fan No Good)
68.review:
I setup my system and it worked great for a week. The system output amazing sound and bass. After a week the system crashed and presented a FAN NG error. I thought the fan was dirty so I looked at the air intake to ensure there was no visible dust. System no longer works.

Stay away from this system and get something that works.
68.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

69.author: Reviewer99
69.review: This is an easy system to set up. The system sound at max is still low as compared to other systems. Worked for 9 months then started getting a loud buzzing sound from the receiver. Apparently some part inside went bad - it was not coming from the speakers. Sony would not warrant the work since this was a gift and all I had was the shipping packing list from UPS. I would not recommend any Sony Product based the fact they will not stand behind their product. I would recommend you purchase the Best Buy extended warranty if you want to take a chance with this system.
69.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

70.author: Bruin
70.review: The audio return connection,ARC, did not work with my roku TCL TV. It possibly could be the TV's fault and not the Samsung 's. Trying to get help from Best Buy's Geek Squad was a joke. Over the phone they told me I had to do this on line. With a live chat. The people on the live chat told me I had to do it over the phone. Both devices were bought at Best Buy and I would have thought I would have gotten more assistance. All they want to do was send a service person out. Make some more money I guess.
70.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

71.author: Wiz090217
71.review: Bought this on my account to add some rewards to an item my parents wanted to buy on black friday, since I wasn't contemplating any other purchases at the time, and rewards expire...(even though they kinda don't). It took a while to actually ship, and I installed it for them in their newly finished basement just before Christmas when I was visiting. Seems to have pretty good sound and wireless surround feature works perfectly, saving a >$70 Rocketfish purchase of a device to do the same thing.
71.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

72.author: Kgreen
72.review: We replaced an older version that starting acting funny. We were excited with the new look and features but are disappointed w the performance. It does not allow for multiple HDMI... uses a new Optical cable and one HDMI. There are many FIOS channels where we do not get sound... sometimes it is just commercials or the entire show or channel. For whatever reason it does recognize the format and we can't find a setting or opton that will make it work. Every once in awhile... the speakers make a pop noise for no reason. Other than that, it works fine.
72.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

73.author: Steve
73.review: Poor performance. Bought because rear speakers were wired to a wireless receiver and could be hidden behind a couch. This replaced another theatre in a box by Panasonic that worked well until it broke. This system did not perform. Rear speakers could only be heard if pressed to your ear despite being at maximum volume. Set up was by Geek Squad. Furthermore, it is supposed to have Bluetooth but it did not work. Bite the bullet and invest in a system that works. Wasted a lot of time.
73.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

74.author: MightyMouse
74.review: Got this unit to replace my older Samsung Home Theater. Mated this one to my new Samsung 58" TV and it's simply awesome! Blu-ray is great and the tuner, apps, radio, etc all work well. Only gripe is that the remote can be a bit tricky and you have to turn the unit on before you can choose the input/source, whereas on the older home theater unit I had I could simply directly select the source from the remote. No biggie. I'd definitely recommend this unit if you appreciate Samsung technology. They got it right on this one!
74.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

75.author: Steve2
75.review:
This player and sound system works seamlessly with my Samsung 75" television connected via an HDMI cable. I bought it primarily because of the wireless rear speakers.
Overall, movies sound very good with the surround sound. Music discs sound satisfactory as well. I understand we can stream music via WiFi, but have not tried it yet.
The blu-ray will connect to WiFi so we can get Hulu, Netflix and what have you.
Be sure to plug this into a surge protector. My previous model from over a year ago quit working properly because of power outages and spiking voltage.
75.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

76.author: UncleAl
76.review: I replaced an older Samsung unit (No Blue ray) with this one and have been very. pleased. Installation was straight forward and it tool longer to put up the shelf bracket than to install the entire system.. The WiFi (Which the old system didn't have) connected first try and I particularly liked the wireless rear speakers. I had to spend an additional $80 for a Rocketfish Rear Speaker adapter. This is basically the same rear speaker style unit, it's just included in the package. An additional Plus, By being patient I was able to catch the $50 off sale.
76.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

77.author: D1maddog1
77.review:
I wanted this for my kids' room, to connect their XBOX ONE S & television to. 

This was beyond perfect. VERY easy setup...the rear surround speakers and receiver link immediately to the main unit; the fact that I didn't have to run speaker wire was awesome. The wires for all six speakers (1x center, 2x front, 2x surround, and 1x subwoofer) were individually color-coded. AND for a subwoofer that is not externally powered, the bass is incredible.
77.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

78.author: D1212
78.review: I use every feature of this system. The speakers are amazing. The apps on it work flawlessly - Netflix, HuluPlus, Amazon Prime, YouTube. I can control YouTube via my iPhone, it has a Bluetooth feature and let's me play my music off my iPhone through its speakers. It plays CDs, DVDs, and bluray without a problem. The quality is 100%. I do have an HD, 3D, smart tv, with high speed broadband hooked into the TV. This system compliments my tv and makes it run even better. I'm perfectly happy with it!!!
78.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

79.author: kombat
79.review_title: Decent. Get what you pay for.
79.review:
It works well enough. I was upgrading an existing HTIB that was left by previous home owners. This doesn't include any mounting hardware for the speakers, so I just left the old ones up. Also, the Netflix app doesn't do surround sound, which on a home theater system is absurd beyond belief. I don't know who that's on: Samsung or Netflix. I tried calling Samsung but the lady was no help whatsoever.

Bluetooth is a nice feature, as you can not only stream from your phone, but it will also connect to our Amazon Echo Dot.
79.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

80.author: KPWildWest
80.review:
- Great sound.
- Fast app response (Amazon, Netflix).
- Bluetooth mode is useful for playing music from a mobile device.
- DLNA video support is NOT so good: limited A/V CODEC combination support, doesn't show video thumbnails from Twonky Server (WD MyCloud for example), date of files is not displayed correctly (all video files are displayed as modified on Jan.01.1970).
- VIDEOS interface crashes / freezes often requiring a reboot of system.
- I have been using this device for almost 2 months now and have the latest available firmware installed on it.
80.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

81.author: MDH1
81.review: I gave this 4 stars because of the remote. Small and confusing. I have an old Samsung which I ❤️. The old model from 2010 is much better. It’s confusing because it is very different from my old model. This system has nice sound quality but the screen setup is different from my old one. I’m still getting use to it. I bought this over the new bar system that they have out. I’ve only seen up to 300 watts. I love the surround sound quality. I will take 1000 watts any day.
81.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

82.author: Brady
82.review: Bought this to replace another Samsung HTIB HT-H5500W. It failed just over a year from purchase... this time I bought the Best Buy extended coverage. It is a little better than the Samsung HT-H5500W that it replaces. Good audio control and sound. I had to turn the front speakers way down and the rear speakers to get the sound I was looking for. If you get one with wireless rear speakers and they cut in and out, take it back ASAP. My new HTIB does not have any issues with the wireless rear speakers, but my old one did. Overall a good product
82.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

83.author: willeycoyote
83.review_title: Good System, but rear speakers seem sub-par.
83.review: Received my Samsung system quickly. Set up/install was very straight forward and easy. Love the idea of "wireless" rear speakers. *Not wireless to the main unit, but still wired to bluetooth receiver set in back of room. I adjusted 5.1 speaker levels and noticed "grey" noise from all speakers, but when watching TV/DVD/BLUE-RAY, rear speakers are extremely quiet. I have since maxed out dB levels for both rear, and minimized front speaker values. Can still barely hear surround sound.
83.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

84.author: Becky
84.review: We got the blu-ray theater system to replace the old dvd theater system we had. The only thing wrong with the old system is that you could not play the TV thru the system and the volume on the TV had to be turned all the way up in order for us to hear it since we have such a large room. This blu-ray theater system lets us watch regular TV which is perfect. We are no longer missing the conversations on TV. This system was very easy to set up and we are not a technical household. I would definitely recommend this product.
84.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

85.author: HomeTHTRman
85.review_title: A solid, powerful performance that sounded good
85.review: Strength between speakers was really good, none were overpowering. Volume levels adjusted easy and had enough power to allow many people to hear even with quiet conversations. Adjustable equalizer could have hade more frequency levels to adjust, but allowed a bit of personalization to my liking. I did find with the 'Logan' Blu-ray, there were video pauses that were not matched with sound pauses as if the laser couldn't keep ahead of the reading before play function.
85.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

86.author: COIronman
86.review:
We bought this to replace an old LG system that that gone out. The overall sound quality, in my opinion, is "poor" to "fair" and I honestly wish I'd spent a little more money to get a better quality wireless system.

The thing that's nice about this system is that it's very user friendly to set up, then two rear mounts are wireless to an extent which keeps you from running wires across your living room (thought I've never heard them come on in anything we've watched).

Overall, it's a decent system for the money.
86.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

87.author: Matt
87.review:
I own an older version of this system from five years ago, so I knew what I was getting into with this system. I was looking to retire that system to the bedroom and get something to replace it, but I didn't want to deal with running speaker wire to rear speakers. This unit meets those needs well.

Pros:
Wireless rear speakers
Good sound for the type of unit and cost
Bluetooth

Cons:
Cheap looking remote, compared with older model
Clunky menu
I had to boost the levels on the passive sub, but after doing so it sounds good
87.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

88.author: HomeTheaterEnthusist
88.review: This system is very reliable in regards to its sound quality. The omni-directional subwoofer delivers perfect sound to fill the viewing area. The features on this unit (Blutooth, pre-installed applications) almost make it unnecessary to have any other device. This system is very easy to use. I have mine connected to my television from a digital audio cable. Occasionally when using certain devices (PlayStation 4) there is an audio delay but it is easily fixed in the settings of the sounds system.
88.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

89.author: Alarkaboy
89.review: You can always depend on Samsung products. This Smart Blu-ray Home Theater System was very easy to set up. The speaker wires have color coded that plug into the system so you will not cross up left and right. The sound is outstanding including the wireless speakers. The wireless speakers are plugged into a wireless device that connects wireless to the system. All of the speakers connect to the system with a wire but you do not have to run wireless all around to get the sound to the rear speakers.
89.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

90.author: partypooper7
90.review: Bought this on sale and installed it myself (I am 70 year old female) Had one hiccup and had to ask a 24 year old neighbor, could not get the satellite speakers to work (wireless). Was short one piece of equipment to get that done. Only complaint would be that longer wires would be a luxury for the front speakers. Great sound for our modest size family room. The neighbors have not complained yet but they may we crank the movies up.
90.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

91.author: Matt
91.review_title: Exactly was I was looking for
91.review: After a failed purchase of a Sony sound bar, I returned to the store and searched for a more powerful home theater system. I found this Samsung with wireless surround speakers (nice touch) and 1000 watts of power. The sound makes you feel like if you were at the movie theater, the bass is great and the design is awesome with a glossy finish. As all newer models they are ARC capable meaning your home theater will sync with your smart tv. Love this product so far.
91.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

92.author: Braynlilysmom
92.review_title: Great surround sound for the cost
92.review: i purchased the previous model of this last year and it was stolen in February when my house was broken into, I liked it so much I bought the upgraded one. While I like this one and the connection to the wifi is MUCH better, I don't know if I'm missing the setting but the rear speakers rarely come on and from what I read they only come on for like special sound effects, I like my rear speakers on at all times.
